intro: Calantica pseudobiseriata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calantica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae, which includes irises and related species. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
